description.narrative: CJSC Credit Europe Bank Ltd (CEB) is a mid-size Moscow-based bank which operates in Russia since 1997. Initially set up as a corporate bank, CEB has gradually expanded its activities to consumer finance, retail and SME banking. As of today, CEB ranks among Russias top 50 banks with assets over $3 billion and equity in excess of $500 million. The Bank operates in 23 regions via 110 branches, 276 ATMs and 4500 point of sales, servicing about to 2.5 million retail customers, 10,000 SMEs and 900 corporate clients throughout Russia. The Project is aimed at supporting CEBs regional expansion plans and its lending activities to SMEs and consumer retail. In addition, IFCs participation in the Project will help CEB secure long-term and diversified funding, thereby enhancing IFCs role as a reliable partner in challenging times.

The Project is expected to have a demonstration impact as well as a developmental impact. The demonstration impact will be achieved by assisting a viable financial institution in accessing the syndication market and international investors in a challenging environment. IFCs support will contribute to bring additional stability and diversification to CEBs funding. On the developmental front, the Project will indirectly support the Russian SME sector, which suffers from a chronic shortage of funding options. This Project will also enable CEB to keep on growing its regional distribution channels and branch network, which in turn will generate new employment opportunities in regions where such opportunities are often limited.
